remarks: Pigeonhole principle expressed with implicit substitution.  If the range is smaller than the domain, two inputs must be mapped to the same output.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 19-Oct-2014.)  (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 6-May-2015.)
statement:
fphpd.a $e |- ( ph -> B ~< A ) $.
fphpd.b $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> C e. B ) $.
fphpd.c $e |- ( x = y -> C = D ) $.
fphpd $p |- ( ph -> E. x e. A E. y e. A ( x =/= y /\ C = D ) ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d B x y $.
$d C y $.
$d D x $.
$d ph x y $.
